identification.role: Roman officer, administrative specialist, intelligence coordinator; one of the Four Arcani; economic predator
identification.primary_narrative_function: Economic predator exploiting desperation for profit while maintaining helpful facade

physical_description.build: Average to slightly above; unremarkable by design; soft; maintained through administrative work

distinctive_features.eyes: Constantly calculating; assess situations for advantage
distinctive_features.face: Appears approachable and reasonable; smile suggests genuine warmth (false)
distinctive_features.bearing: Designed not to stand out; makes himself appear less threatening than he is
distinctive_features.hair: Dark; well-maintained but not ostentatiously so
distinctive_features.posture: Deceptively casual; can shift to command authority when needed

physical_description.visual_signature: Well-groomed, comfortable appearance; seems to fit into any situation; wealth becomes evident as profits mount

primary_traits.description: No conscience constraining options; can do anything; willing to exploit anyone
Brilliant at reading people and situations; understands motivations; manipulates effectively
Understands complex systems and profit potential; creates monopolies; exploits scarcity
Can convince almost anyone to do what benefits him; negotiations always favor him
Appears as pragmatic problem-solver; sophisticated, diplomatic presentation; readers trust his reasoning

strengths.shows_in: Understands motivations; manipulates effectively; builds networks through apparent sympathy
Creates monopolies; exploits scarcity; positions for maximum advantage
Negotiations always favor him; others believe they're getting fair deals
Readers trust his reasoning until they realize every solution creates dependency and profit

flaws_and_vulnerabilities.manifestation: Cannot build genuine partnerships; always calculating; everyone is potential profit source; fundamentally alone
Assumes everyone is as compromised as he is; may underestimate followers' resilience; doesn't understand spiritual motivation
Without occupation creating chaos, has limited opportunity; needs conflict to profit; vulnerable to peace
Spiritual motivation he doesn't understand may overcome economic pressure

core_motivations: Maximize personal wealth through systematic economic exploitation
Coordinate with other Arcani to create economic collapse
Maintain sophisticated appearance while profiting from desperation

relationships.dynamic: Brutus's military pressure creates Corvus's profit opportunities; professional respect; mutual recognition of ruthlessness
Maximus's chaos creates Corvus's profit opportunities; strategic coordination
Horatius eliminates economic competitors; Corvus secures monopoly; maximum profit

story_arc.opening_state: Well-groomed, comfortable appearance; appears as helpful problem-solver; already predatory
story_arc.transformation: Visibly wealthier; monopolies established; mask maintained; predatory nature revealed
story_arc.closing_state: Wealth evident in every detail; comfort with chaos as profit opportunity; economic predator fully revealed

thematic_significance: Pragmatism as mask for absolute amorality
Famine and economic collapse through manipulation
character.why_readers_care: Corvus represents the insidious nature of economic exploitation. His character demonstrates how sophisticated, reasonable-sounding justifications can mask absolute amorality. Readers are drawn to his intelligence and apparent problem-solving, even as they sense something is wrong. His descent from helpful administrator to revealed economic predator shows how systems of exploitation can be built behind masks of pragmatism. Through Corvus, readers see how desperation can be weaponized for profit, and how apparent solutions can create dependency.
character_questions_for_readers: How do we recognize when help is actually exploitation?
What is the difference between problem-solving and creating dependency?
How does scarcity become a tool of control?
Can intelligence and sophistication be used for pure exploitation?
